meanings.definition: Worthy of being commanded or deserving of praise.
meanings.sent1: The brave soldier's actions were truly commandable.
meanings.sent2: Her hard work and dedication made her a commandable employee.
meanings.sent3: The puppy's attempt to protect its owner was quite commandable.
meanings.sent4: The artist's masterpiece was a commandable display of talent.
meanings.sent5: The student's improvement in grades was truly commandable.

meanings.definition: Capable of being commanded or controlled.
meanings.sent1: The new software is very commandable and easy to use.
meanings.sent2: The well-trained dog proved to be quite commandable.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's attempt to organize toys was not very commandable.
meanings.sent4: The wind was commandable as it guided the sailboat effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The robot's movements were precise and commandable.
